body: I tried to check "no" on "assemble with identity only" and it's running fine for now but the individual identity is important for my research.

@Shachafbe did you train the network with `identity = True` set in config.yaml ? 

and can you please check the exact version with ipython, import deeplabcut > `deeplabcut.__version__`

Thank you for the quick reply. 
I did train with identity = True
The version is:  '2.2.0.3'
`len(inds)` --> what is the # of individuals in your `config.yaml`?

The number of individuals is 5. 

actually, in the beginning, I tagged frames of 5 animals. Then I saw one of them is missing a lot so I tried to remove it from the config after labeling (left with 4 individuals) but it made errors at certain steps of the training (don't remember which one) so I returned it to 5 animals and did the training again. Maybe it still changed something? I did try to change it to 4 animals to run the "convert to tracklets" now but it gave me the same error

hmm... indeed once you start labeling you can't drop individuals; when you track you pass the n_tracks (in the GUI you set the # of animals you want to track for a particular video). It does seems something is odd about your project (DLC is working otherwise and passing all function tests), given the 4-5 swap, but it's odd you are getting length=zero for individuals... check your pose_cfg.yaml and also the inference_cfg.yaml and be sure topktoretain is 5.

 btw, you might consider upgrading to 2.2.0.5, the GUI workflow is nicer.

besides the individuals list in the config file and the topKtoretain parameter in the inference_cfg file is there another parameter influencing the number of animals? 
The topKtoretain was 4. I change it and run only the convert to tracklet again- got the same error. What steps are using the parameters from the inference_cfg file? I will try to run them again.
@jeylau might have other ideas, but i'm not sure what else to recommend

I think somehow I mess things up when I tried to remove one animal at the beginning. I'm hoping to avoid tagging all over again, so if there is a way I can use the same tagged frames to fix it and do the training again in some way, it will be a great help.
And anyway thank you for the try!

@Shachafbe if you want to send me your configs (main, test/train fg, inference), I can try to take a look if I see anything amiss! admin@deeplabcut.org -- I know you're a long time user and I want to get it running for ya :)
Hey @Shachafbe, does it work fine if turning the calibration step off?

issue.title: Properly handle empty assemblies

labels.name: bug fix!
labels.description: fix for a real buggy one...

repository.name: DeepLabCut
repository.description: Official implementation of DeepLabCut: Markerless pose estimation of user-defined features with deep learning for all animals incl. humans

license.name: GNU Lesser General Public License v3.0

issue.body:
L708 was letting empty assemblies slip into the rest of the code, causing errors when trying to evaluate the Mahalanobis distance (since `len(inds)` then evaluates to 0). Empty assemblies are now properly removed.

Fixes #1638

body: I think this will be fixed with #1641; empty assemblies are now properly caught before calculating distances.

Hey @Shachafbe can you run this, and try again? 
# Install the latest DeepLabCut version:
`pip install https://github.com/DeepLabCut/DeepLabCut/archive/master.zip`
